New Records: Damian Lillard scored 41 points, matching a career-high for the Milwaukee Bucks against the Cleveland Cavaliers.
Key Match Events: Damian Lillard hit a game-winning jump shot with 9.8 seconds left to give the Bucks a 113-112 lead.
Donovan Mitchell scored a heart-dropping game-winning shot with 0.3 seconds left to secure the Cavaliers' victory.
Pre-Game Insights: Damian Lillard started the game hot, making five 3-point shots in the first quarter to guide the Bucks to an early lead.
Post-Match Reflections: Damian Lillard's 41-point effort was wasted as the Bucks suffered their fifth straight loss, dropping to 1-5 on the season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a back-and-forth contest with no team gaining control until the final moments.
Gary Trent Jr. had a key defensive play, poking the ball out of Donovan Mitchell's hands.
